definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: And this one scotoma also is a good luck actually.
sentences.chinese: 而這一盲點其實也是一個機遇。

sentences.english: Just before pulling out of the parking spot, check your mirrors and your blind spot.
sentences.chinese: 駛出停車區前，查看你的後視鏡及盲點。

sentences.english: A second blind spot is caused by the localised structure of the police.
sentences.chinese: 另一個盲點是由警局的地方結構造成的。

sentences.english: Legislative branch should study this kind of new issue, eliminate jural scotoma .
sentences.chinese: 立法部門應研究這類新問題，消滅法律上的盲點。

sentences.english: Multi-level monitoring, total coverage without any blind spot.
sentences.chinese: 分級監控，從全局到設備，監控無盲點。

sentences.english: This is the meaning of such paintings – we have found the blind-spot of concept.
sentences.chinese: 這是這種畫的意義，我們找到了觀念的盲點。

sentences.english: These blind spots prevent us from reaching the next stage of growth.
sentences.chinese: 這些盲點阻止我們進入成長的下一個階段。

sentences.english: This may be our greatest blind spot.
sentences.chinese: 這或許是我們最大的盲點。

sentences.english: Many people have blind spots when it comes to their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 許多人在談論自己上司的時候常會有一些盲點。

sentences.english: There exists the blind spots in western modem feminist criticisms.
sentences.chinese: 現代西方女性主義批評存在着盲點。

sentences.english: Ride far enough into the lane to avoid the risk from blindspots.
sentences.chinese: 爲規避盲點的風險，與行車道保持一定距離。

sentences.english: My male peers have pointed out my own blind spots in this regard.
sentences.chinese: 我的一些男同事曾經指出我在這方面的盲點。
